text: Hi everyone. I am trying to generate a table from a embedded script in a .md file and save the output to a csv file. Exactly the same way it is done in Franklin's documentation, saving the result using `write("assets/table.csv")`. However, when the script is run, I get `SystemError: opening file "assets/table.csv": No such file or directory` I have tried to remove __site and regenerate it from scratch without any luck. It seems to work if I save it to _assets/table.csv, but I am unsure about whether this is the intended usage.  Am I missing something? Thanks for your help!

elements.text: Hi everyone. I am trying to generate a table from a embedded script in a .md file and save the output to a csv file. Exactly the same way it is done in Franklin's documentation, saving the result using
write("assets/table.csv")
. However, when the script is run, I get
SystemError: opening file "assets/table.csv": No such file or directory

I have tried to remove __site and regenerate it from scratch without any luck. It seems to work if I save it to _assets/table.csv, but I am unsure about whether this is the intended usage.  Am I missing something? Thanks for your help!

text: yes save it to `_assets/table.csv`; could you point me to the part of the docs that you were following and, maybe, to where you use this in your repo so I can have a second look?

text: I am also looking into generating a table from a snippet of code. Is it possible to generate it on-the-fly and without saving a csv to file, like it is done with the plots created with PlotlyJS?

text: Yes, you can also use PrettyTables.jl for HTML output if you want

elements.text: Yes, you can also use PrettyTables.jl for HTML output if you want

text:
Hmm, I am struggling. I tried several ways as described in <https://franklinjl.org/code/#inserting_the_output>, but none worked so far. I tried things like
```julia:./exampletable
#hideall
using PrettyTables

pretty_table([1 5.0; 2 4.0], [“degree” “bound”], backend=:html)
```

\textoutput{./exampletable}

text:
can you try the same but with

```#hideall
using PrettyTables
html = pretty_table([1 5.0; 2 4.0], ["degree" "bound"], backend=:html)
println("~~~$html~~~")```

elements.text: can you try the same but with

#hideall
using PrettyTables
html = pretty_table([1 5.0; 2 4.0], ["degree" "bound"], backend=:html)
println("~~~$html~~~")

text: ah wait you need to  go through an io object, give me a sec

elements.text: ah wait you need to  go through an io object, give me a sec

text:
``````julia:extable
#hideall
using PrettyTables
io = IOBuffer()
pretty_table(io, [1 5.0; 2 4.0], ["degree" "bound"], backend=:html);
println("~~~", String(take!(io)), "~~~")
```

\textoutput{extable}```
works

elements.text:
```julia:extable
#hideall
using PrettyTables
io = IOBuffer()
pretty_table(io, [1 5.0; 2 4.0], ["degree" "bound"], backend=:html);
println("~~~", String(take!(io)), "~~~")
```

\textoutput{extable}
works
